physDesc.additional: Ornamental lotus drawing in the center of the cover page. Below the drawing the note: spyod 'jug yig xxxx sna bzhugs lags so written in dbu can. "sna" possibly stands for "sna tshogs bzhugs lags so," indicating a text belonging to various categories. Script: 'bru tsha. Lines per folio: 8; 7 on the last folio. Folio numbers above 10 written with the decimal in letters and the units as a number (except "five," which is written in letters). Orthography: - frequent broken shad - frequent abbreviations - bindu for -m - Tibetan numerals written in cyphers - superabundant 'a suffixes (e.g., dbye' ba) Some corrections in dbu can (e.g., fol. 2a6). Numerous interlinear annotations in dbu med and dbu can, that appear to be more frequent at the beginning of the text. Below 4b7, some numerals apparently counting the sa bcad divisions. Long annotation at the bottom of fol. 12b, with a reference sign repeated on 12b7. Several annotations identifying scholars that are not named in the text are preceded by the same sign. Frequent ornaments between gnyis shad and bzhi shad. sbrul shad used on fol. 2a1, and rgya gram shad in the middle of 3a6, 13b5, 17a3 and 23b6. Ornament containing a pebble and a sbrul shad in the middle of fol. 15b5. On the color images (bdr:MW14345) one can see some expressions written in red ink (with vowels in black) and some expressions highlighted in yellow.

par med pa'i phyir ro || des na mi khom pa dang bral ba nyid la‹la› khom pa dang 'byor pa ces bya'o zhes zer te mi rigs | bral ba skyon med dgag dgag ldog dang 'byor pa yon tan ma yin dgag sgrub ldog ldog pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro ||

kha cig lo tsha ba smon pa ni 'bras bu la dam 'cha' pa yin la ¦
'jug pa ni byang chub kyi rgyu la dam 'cha' ba'i sdom pa nyid do zhes zer ba yang mi rigs ste ¦ sems bskyed kyi mtshan nyid ma tshang pa dang ¦ sems bskyed dang bslab pa'i ming 'dogs so sor mdzad pa'i phyir ro ||
dang po la so so'i mtshan nyid ni kha cig stod lung rgya mar na re kun rdzob shes bya dang don daM shes bya las 'das pa'o zhes zer ro ||

rtsang paTentative identification as the author, gTsang nag pa, whose own answer is also provided in the next paragraph. ni de lta na dngos po chos can bum pa lta bu 1 la la shes byas khyab pa mngon sum gyis grub pa na don dam pa'i bden pa tsam khegs pa na snang pa la don dam pa 'gegs pa'i rjes dpag gis dgag mi dgos par thal | bum pa de don dam pa'i dngos por rtogs pas bum pa de shes bya ma yin pa'i dngos por
rtogs par thal ba ci'i phyir... mngon sum snang pa'i phyir ro dang ¦ don dam zhes pa'i mtshon bya las buM pa de...lasogs pa don ldog gzhan du 'gyur ba 'ang yin no ||

shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo' dang bstan bcos las ||
yongs bsdu' rnams thams cad mkhyen nyid lam ||
rten dang sems bskyed tshogs gnyis sgrub pa can ||
'di ni sangs rgyas sras po'i bya bar stan || [Śāntideva] showed this path, which is the road to the omniscient consciousness that is well gathered from the Great extant sūtra (Vaipulyasūtra) and the treatises and is achieving two accumulations of support (rten) and mind-generation (sems bskyed), as the behavior of the Buddha's son.
bdag gis 'gro la phan blos 'bad pa yis ||
rgyal sras spyod pa'i tshig don gsal byas pa'i ||
dge' ba 'di
yispa'i theg mchog lam zhugs pa'i ||
gzhung 'di rnyed nas 'jug cing brtan pa shog || ||Having this virtue of making clear the words and [those] meaning in terms of his behavior of the Conqueror's son (=Boddhisattvacāryāvatāra) by means of my heartfelt effort [urging] sentient beings' benefit by me, May wish that [those] entering the path of the supreme vehicle encounter this text before entering and that [their] practice would be stable.
byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa' la 'jug pa'i 'grel pa legs par bshad pa bsdus pa zhes bya ba | shag kya'i dge' slong brtson 'grus seng ges sbyar pa | rdzogs s+h+yo ||||
